Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let me analyze the key information from each interview: **Interview 1 (Mary - AP Clerk):** - Start: Receive invoice (usually by email) - Step 1: Check if valid PO number exists - If no PO: Send back to supplier requesting details (loop back?) - If yes PO: Log into accounting system. After logging it, I forward it to the purchasing department to confirm that the goods or services were actually received. Once I get confirmation, I match the invoice line items against the PO in the system.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Key roles identified: - Accounts Payable (AP) Clerk (Mary) - Purchasing Officer (Dan) - Department Manager (Carlos) - AP Supervisor (Rita) - Exception handler - Supplier Relationship Manager (Karen) - Exception support - Supplier (external) Key artifacts: - Invoice (email) - Purchase Order (PO) - Accounting system entry - Confirmation emails - Contract (mentioned by Karen)

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Process flow structure: **Main Flow:** 1. Receive Invoice (AP Clerk) 2. Check for PO number (Gateway) - No PO: Request details from Supplier (loop back?) OR Escalate/Handle exception - Yes PO: Log in system 3. Forward to Purchasing for confirmation 4. Purchasing checks against PO (Gateway) 5. AP matches invoice to PO (Gateway) 6. Manager approval (Gateway) 7. Schedule Payment (AP)

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me reconsider the No PO path: Mary says: If it doesnt have a PO, I send it back to the supplier requesting more details. This suggests: - Task: Check for PO - If No: Task: Request PO Details from Supplier (loop) So the No PO path has two possibilities: 1. Send back to supplier to add PO (loop) 2. Escalate to Supervisor for retrospective PO creation

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Let me map this more carefully: **Start:** Invoice Received (by email) **Lane: AP Clerk** 1. Task: Check for Valid PO Number - XOR Gateway: PO Present? - Path A (No): Task: Request PO Details from Supplier Actually, better: If No PO, theres a choice: Request from Supplier OR Escalate to Supervisor for Exception Handling

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: **Happy Path:** 1. Receive Invoice (AP Clerk) 2. Check PO Validity (Gateway: PO Present & Valid?) 3. Log Invoice in Accounting System (AP Clerk) 4. Forward to Purchasing for Confirmation 5. Verify Receipt & PO Details (Purchasing Officer) 6. Gateway: Discrepancy Found? 7. Match Invoice to PO (AP Clerk) 8. Gateway: Match Successful? 9. Review & Approve Invoice (Department Manager) 10. Gateway: Approved? 11. Schedule Payment (AP Clerk)

Name: Validation - PE
Text: **Variations/Ambiguities Identified:** 1. **Missing PO Handling**: Some interviewees describe returning invoices to suppliers for PO addition; others describe creating retrospective POs via the Supervisor for informal contracts. 2. **Discrepancy Resolution Ownership**: Both Purchasing and AP Clerks may contact suppliers directly, or they may involve the Supplier Relationship Manager. This looks comprehensive and accurate based on the transcripts.
